results.headline: A-Team Tracks Nazi Plunder
results.summary_short: In “The Monuments Men,” George Clooney stars as an art historian who leads a quirky crew in a World War II operation to recover troves of artworks stolen by the Nazis.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Monuments Men

results.headline: Postapocalyptic Survival Stories
results.summary_short: In “After the Dark,” a philosophy teacher guides college students through hypothetical postapocalyptic events.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of After the Dark

results.headline: The Buried Treasure Is the Psychedelic Kind
results.summary_short: “A Field in England,” directed by Ben Wheatley, follows a group of deserters whose troubles start when they leave the battlefield.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of A Field In England

results.display_title: Maynila, Sa Mga Uko Ng Liwanag
results.headline: Small Dreams Set Afire on Marcos-Era Streets
results.summary_short: Lino Brocka’s “Manila in the Claws of Light,” at the Museum of Modern Art, is a 1975 movie about the limits to life in the Philippines under the dictator Ferdinand E. Marcos.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Maynila, Sa Mga Uko Ng Liwanag

results.headline: Your Child Is Choosing a College; Time to Tag Along
results.summary_short: The romantic comedy “At Middleton” is also a delicate film about two people confronting their flawed marriages.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of At Middleton

results.headline: Dutch Masterwork, Under Reconstruction
results.summary_short: The documentary “Tim’s Vermeer” tracks one inventor’s bid to determine whether the Dutch master had used optical devices to paint “The Music Lesson” and his own effort to recreate it.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Tim's Vermeer

results.headline: A Study of Sublimated Grief
results.summary_short: In “The Wait,” a call from a stranger unsettles a family whose mother recently died.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Wait

results.headline: For One-Night Lotharios, It’s Time to Face the Truth
results.summary_short: In the sex comedy “That Awkward Moment,” three best buddies make a pact not to be emotionally tangled with women, but then proceed to break the rules.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of That Awkward Moment

results.headline: The Road to Reinvention
results.summary_short: “Somewhere Slow” centers on a woman who impulsively abandons her home and family after witnessing a convenience store robbery.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Somewhere Slow

results.headline: Do Not Look Down in This Class
results.summary_short: “Peter Brook: The Tightrope,” a documentary directed by the subject’s son, peeks in on the theatrical sage as he teaches a class of actors.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Peter Brook: The Tightrope

results.headline: Oscar Shorts, From Surreal to Oh So Real
results.summary_short: The short-film nominees for Oscars — animated, live action and documentaries, from around the world — can be viewed together in three collections.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of The Oscar Nominated Short Films 2014

results.headline: Portrait of Youth
results.summary_short: In “Miss Granny,” a woman whose family plans to place her in a retirement home suddenly turns back into her 20-year-old self.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Miss Granny

results.headline: Former Lovers, Current Seat Mates
results.summary_short: In “Love Is in the Air,” Ludivine Sagnier and Nicolas Bedos play former lovers who are trapped next to each other on a trans-Atlantic flight to Paris.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Amour et Turbulences

results.headline: Is It Love, or Stockholm Syndrome?
results.summary_short: In “Labor Day,” set in a small town in 1987, an escaped criminal takes shelter with a woman and her son and soon wins them over.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Labor Day

results.display_title: HANK: Five Years From the Brink
results.headline: A Central Player in the Financial Crisis Speaks
results.summary_short: In Joe Berlinger’s documentary “Hank: Five Years from the Brink,” Henry M. Paulson Jr., the former Treasury secretary, works his way through a timeline.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of HANK: Five Years From the Brink

results.headline: He’s in Love, but No Closer to Figuring It Out
results.summary_short: The drama “Brightest Star” focuses on romantic relationships, using a young man as the focus.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Brightest Star

results.headline: A Woman Whose Ecstasy Ignited a Riot
results.summary_short: Marielle Nitoslawska’s documentary “Breaking the Frame” chronicles the life and achievements of the avant-garde artist Carolee Schneemann.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Breaking the Frame

results.headline: Thrilling to the Brrroom of a Renegade Cohort
results.summary_short: The documentary “12 O’Clock Boys” follows a youth through his initiation into a group of dirt bike riders who like to taunt the police.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of 12 O'Clock Boys

results.headline: Everyone Wants a Piece of This Wandering Monster
results.summary_short: Aaron Eckhart plays a version of Mary Shelley’s monster in the new film “I, Frankenstein,” also starring Bill Nighy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of I, Frankenstein

results.headline: The Holocaust Lives on in a Fractured Family
results.summary_short: “Papirosen,” a documentary by the filmmaker Gastón Solnicki, follows generations of his Polish-Argentine family.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Papirosen
